answers.answer: I'm sorry I've never heard of it.  But atleast at this point you are 32 weeks and SHOULD THEY decide to deliver you early...baby has excellant chances.  I hope everything works out for the best and you don't have any serious complications.
yeah that. HELLP syndrom. LOL. they have all these wierd names for everything

Well, If I were you dont get yourself worked up intill you find out the results on monday. But if you need deed have this, it is no joke. And you will prob. delivery early(if you have it)........Let us know!!

I will let you know. Im trying not to think about it. Im just going to take it easy this weekend. She said that I get more increased pain this weekend to go to L&D and they will call her and she will see me there. I will be 33 weeks on monday also so if we do have to deliver the baby then I know he will make it. He will just be in the hospital a little longer than expected but other than that he should be fine. Thanks for you help ladies!!!

I dont know anything about HELLP syndrome but if you dont have that, I can tell you a bit about the high blood pressure aspect of your post and what to expect from that since this is also considered a complication.If you have developed gestational hypertension (blood pressure readings are above a certain cut-off on TWO separate occasions) then your doctor will make some suggestions on controlling the high BP.  Depending on your current circumstances (how high your BP is, whether you work, any other symptoms etc.) attempts to reduce your BP could range from a reduced work schedule, change in diet, medications, bedrest, to more extreme measures of hospitalization and possibly early delivery if the condition is extreme, can not be controlled and your baby is under stress.  Depending on your numbers, your doctor may want you to come in for a non-stress test and/or amniotic fluid index reading on a regular basis to make sure baby is doing ok and your urine will be checked on a regular basis for protein to make sure you are not developing pre-eclampsia.   The doctor will not let you get past your due date w/ hypertension but will try and keep the baby in you as long as possible - usually they will induce around 39 weeks but again, it depends on the situation.I hope things turn out ok for you, but you are correct that in the worst possible scenario (delivery at this point) your son stands an EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT, chance!

The only effective treatment is delivery of the baby. Several medications have been investigated for the treatment of HELLP syndrome, but evidence is conflicting as to whether magnesium sulfate decreases the risk of seizures and progress to eclampsia. The DIC is treated with fresh frozen plasma to replenish the coagulation proteins, and the anemia may require blood transfusion. In mild cases, corticosteroids and antihypertensives (labetalol, hydralazine, nifedipine) may be sufficient. Intravenous fluids are generally required.Its incidence is reported as 0.2-0.6% of all pregnancies, and 10-20% of women with comorbid preeclampsia. HELLP usually begins during the third trimester, and usually in Caucasian women over the age of 25. (Padden, 1999) Rarely cases have been reported as early as 23 weeks gestation. The outcome for mothers with HELLP syndrome is generally good. With treatment, maternal mortality is about 1 percent. However complications have been observed, including abruptio placentae, acute renal failure, subcapsular liver hematoma, and retinal detachment.SO if you do have it, it looks as if everything will be okay for you and you will probably meet your baby sooner than expected!
i had this problem at 38 weeks but the pain you explain felt more like pressure to me and i delivered my son in about 13 hours from the time i left the docs office....
I have an appointment today at 11 my time (im in Cali) so when I get back I will let you ladies know what she says. Thanks for thinking of me :)
She said that my liver is a little inflammed but not too much so she is going to just keep an eye on it. So im happy about that. Also I am 1 cm dialated and she wants to see me again in 2 weeks.
Thats great to hear.Keep us posted!
Hopefully dilation is what was causing the pain. We'll keep our fingers crossed, but so far sounds like you and baby are doing just fine.

question: So I went today for my 32 week checkup and my blood pressure was high once again so they had me lay on my left side and they took it again and it was still high just not as high as it was before. So then the doctor comes in and I tell her about the pain in my right side and how its been spreading to my back and left side and the top of my stomach sssooo she sent me to the lab to get a whole bunch of blood work done because she thinks that I might have an enlarged liver (I think she called it Hells Syndrom or something) and she will see me monday to discuss the results... Have any of you had this or know about it?? What is the treatment?? Are they going to make me have the baby early?? Im so confused and upset. Online i looked it up and all the websites all say different things...
title: Back from doc appt.... Not good...
